item.title: About me
item.description: I am a postdoc researcher at Brandeis University in the laboratory of Dr. Piali Sengupta. Our lab studies the structure and function of the neuronal sensory aparatus in the roundworm, C. elegans. This nematode offers a unique system to study sensory biology, owing to its fully-identified cell lineage (consisting of 302 invariant neurons), its place as the only animal with a complete neuronal connectivity map, as well as its powerful genetic toolkit.

Feeding state-dependent regulation of developmental plasticity via CaMKI and neuroendocrine signaling. Elife, 2015. Michael P. O’Donnell and Greg J. Bashaw. Distinct functional domains of the Abelson tyrosine kinase control axon guidance responses to Netrin and Slit to regulate the assembly of neural circuits.
